TextpageLeftNav.bodyText:
Page BlobPage Blob

Optimized for random read and write options

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

Page Blobs have been optimized for random read and write options. Page Blobs are well suited to scenarios where a random segment of a known address needs to be covered, for example, when storing index-based and sparse data structures. Page Blobs can be accessed through REST protocols or attached to virtual machines to support disk communication as unmanaged disks.

Pricing Details

  • General Purpose v2
  • General Purpose v1

General Purpose v2 provides access to the latest Azure storage features, including Cool and Archive storage, with pricing optimized for the lowest GB storage prices. These accounts provide access to Block Blobs, Page Blobs, Files, and Queues.

Premium Page Blobs prices

Premium Non-Managed Disk, a high-performance storage based on a solid state drive (SSD), aims to support I/O intensive workloads through extremely large throughput and extremely low delay. With the help of Premium Non-Managed Disk, we can set permanent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics.

The total expenses of Premium Non-Managed Disk depends on the disk size and quantity, and is subjected to the data transmission. The disk size provides different input/output operations per second (IOP), throughput limit and monthly pricing per GB. We can select necessary options most appropriate to applications, including storage size, IOP and throughput. We can add several permanent disks onto the VM and configure at most 64 TB storage space to every VM. The disk throughput of every VM can reach up to 80,000 (number of input/output operations per second) and 1600 MB/second, with a read delay of less than 1 millisecond. Premium Non-Managed Disk is supported by the sizes of the DS Series, DSv2 Series and FS Series VMs exclusively used for Premium Disk. The pricing and billing meters of DS Series VMs are the same as the D Series VMs.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.
Page Blob Types P10 P20 P30 P40 P50 P601
Disk sizes 128 GB 512 GB 1 TB 2 TB 4 TB 8 TB
Monthly pricing ￥ 132.15 ￥ 490.93 ￥ 906.29 ￥ 1,736.83 ¥ 3,322.63 ¥ 6,343.21
IOPS per Page Blob 500 2,300 5,000 7,500 7,500 7,500
Throughput per Page Blob 100 MB /second 150 MB /second 200 MB /second 250 MB /second 250 MB /second 250 MB /second
There are no transaction costs for Premium Page Blobs. Your Premium Page Blob is charged based on the lowest type that supports your target size.

1 Azure does not support P60 serving as the disk of the Virtual Machine. Page Blob supports accessing P60 through REST.

We also support three additional page blob types that require you to deploy with Blob Tier set explicitly. If you deploy the page blob or unmanaged disks only specifying the target size, it will be rounded up to the supported page blob types listed in the table above.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.
P4 P6 P15
Disk sizes 32 GB 64 GB 256 GB
Monthly pricing ¥ 47.53 ¥ 91.9 ¥ 254.86
IOPS per Page Blob 120 240 1,100
Throughput per Page Blob 25 MB /second 50 MB /second 125 MB /second

The pricing of screenshots is charged at the rate of ￥ 2.35/GB per month.

Standard Page Blob data storage prices

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

Locally-redundant storage (LRS) Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS) Read-access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS)
¥ 0.4579/GB ￥ 0.6106/GB ¥ 0.7632/GB

1 1 TB = 1,024 GB

Prices for operation of a Page Blob used as an unmanaged disk

A Standard Page Blob attached to a virtual machine and used as an unmanaged disk costs ￥ 0.0051 per 10,000 transactions. Various types of unmanaged disk operations are counted as transactions, including reads, writes, and deletes.

Prices for Page Blob operation (non-disk)

Page Blob transactions are billed per transaction if they are not executed through a VM. For each transaction, a single operation should be billed as a read, write, or delete operation. If the size of a read or write transaction exceeds 64 KB, then an additional read or write input/output (IO) charge needs to be paid every time 64 KB is exceeded, with up to 15 IO charges per transaction. If the transaction size exceeds 1 MB [64 KB x (1 transaction + 15 IOs)], there are no other IO charges regardless of the transaction size.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

Locally-redundant storage (LRS) Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS) Read-access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS)
Writes 1 (per 10,000 counted) ¥ 0.0153 ￥ 0.3053 ¥ 0.3053
Write additional IO units (per 10,000 counted) ¥ 0.0237 ￥ 0.0474 ¥ 0.0474
Read2 (per 10,000 counted) ¥ 0.0153 ￥ 0.0153 ¥ 0.0153
Read additional IO units (per 10,000 counted) ¥ 0.0017 ￥ 0.0017 ¥ 0.0017
Delete Free Free Free
1 The following API calls are considered to be write options: AbortCopyBlob, AppendBlock, BreakBlobLease, BreakContainerLease, ChangeBlobLease, ChangeContainerLease, CopyBlob, CreateContainer, IncrementalCopyBlob, PutBlob, PutGeoMessage, PutGeoRepairMessageMeasurementEvent, PutGeoVerificationMessageMeasurementEvent, PutPage, SetBlobMetadata, SetBlobProperties, SetBlobServiceProperties, SetContainerACL, SetContainerMetadata, SnapshotBlob and UndeleteBlob.

2 The following API calls are considered to be read operations: AcquireBlobLease, AcquireContainerLease, BlobPreflightRequest, GeoBootstrap, GetBlob, GetBlobLeaseInfo, GetBlobMetadata, GetBlobProperties, GetBlobServiceProperties, GetBlobServiceStats, GetBlockList, GetContainerACL, GetContainerMetadata, GetContainerProperties, GetCopyInformation, GetEncryptionKey, GetPageRegions, ReleaseBlobLease, ReleaseContainerLease, RenewBlobLease and RenewContainerLease.

General Purpose v1 has the lowest transaction prices, while its storage prices are higher. It can be used to access Block Blobs, Page Blobs, Files, Queues, and Tables. General Purpose v1 accounts do not support access to Cool and Archive storage.

Premium Page Blobs prices

Premium Non-Managed Disk, a high-performance storage based on a solid state drive (SSD), aims to support I/O intensive workloads through extremely large throughput and extremely low delay. With the help of Premium Non-Managed Disk, we can set permanent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics.

The total expenses of Premium Non-Managed Disk depends on the disk size and quantity, and is subjected to the data transmission. The disk size provides different input/output operations per second (IOP), throughput limit and monthly pricing per GB. We can select necessary options most appropriate to applications, including storage size, IOP and throughput. We can add several permanent disks onto the VM and configure at most 64 TB storage space to every VM. The disk throughput of every VM can reach up to 80,000 (number of input/output operations per second) and 1600 MB/second, with a read delay of less than 1 millisecond. Premium Non-Managed Disk is supported by the sizes of the DS Series, DSv2 Series and FS Series VMs exclusively used for Premium Disk. The pricing and billing meters of DS Series VMs are the same as the D Series VMs.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.
Page Blob Types P10 P20 P30 P40 P50 P601
Disk sizes 128 GB 512 GB 1 TB 2 TB 4 TB 8 TB
Monthly pricing ￥ 132.15 ￥ 490.93 ￥ 906.29 ￥ 1,736.83 ¥ 3,322.63 ¥ 6,343.21
IOPS per Page Blob 500 2,300 5,000 7,500 7,500 7,500
Throughput per Page Blob 100 MB /second 150 MB /second 200 MB /second 250 MB /second 250 MB /second 250 MB /second
There are no transaction costs for Premium Page Blobs. Your Premium Page Blob is charged based on the lowest type that supports your target size.

1 Azure does not support P60 serving as the disk of the Virtual Machine. Page Blob supports accessing P60 through REST.

We also support three additional page blob types that require you to deploy with Blob Tier set explicitly. If you deploy the page blob or unmanaged disks only specifying the target size, it will be rounded up to the supported page blob types listed in the table above.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

*Monthly pricing estimates are based on 744 hours of usage per month.
P4 P6 P15
Disk sizes 32 GB 64 GB 256 GB
Monthly pricing ¥ 47.53 ¥ 91.9 ¥ 254.86
IOPS per Page Blob 120 240 1,100
Throughput per Page Blob 25 MB /second 50 MB /second 125 MB /second

The pricing of screenshots is charged at the rate of ￥ 2.35/GB per month.

Standard Page Blob prices

Standard Disks employ a hard disk drive (HDD)-based storage medium. They are most suitable for development/testing not sensitive to performance changes and other non-frequent access workloads.

There is a charge for Standard Non-Managed Disk based on data storage size (GB), quantity of transactions, and the volume of Data Transfer.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

Locally-redundant storage (LRS) Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS) Read-access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS)
￥ 0.275/GB ￥ 0.55/GB ￥ 0.66/GB

Prices for operation of a Page Blob used as an unmanaged disk

A Standard Page Blob attached to a virtual machine and used as an unmanaged disk costs ￥ 0.0037 per 10,000 transactions. Various types of unmanaged disk operations are counted as transactions, including reads, writes, and deletes.

Prices for Page Blob operation (non-disk)

If the transactions of Page Blob are not performed by Virtual Machines, billing is done by the transaction. For every transaction, a single operation shall be considered as write, read or delete for billing. If the size of the read or write is more than 64 KB, an extra read/write (IO) expense will be charged for every excess of 64 KB, and up to 15 IO are charged per transaction. If the size of a transaction is more than 1 MB [64 KB x (1 transaction + 15 IOs)], other IOs are not charged, irrespective of the size of transactions.

*The following prices are tax-inclusive.

Locally-redundant storage (LRS) Geo-Redundant Storage (GRS) Read-access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS)
Writes 1 (per 10,000 counted) ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044
Write additional IO units (per 10,000 counted) Free Free Free
Read2 (per 10,000 counted) ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044
Read additional IO units (per 10,000 counted) Free Free Free
Delete ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044 ￥ 0.0044
1 The following API calls are considered to be write options: AbortCopyBlob, AppendBlock, BreakBlobLease, BreakContainerLease, ChangeBlobLease, ChangeContainerLease, CopyBlob, CreateContainer, IncrementalCopyBlob, PutBlob, PutGeoMessage, PutGeoRepairMessageMeasurementEvent, PutGeoVerificationMessageMeasurementEvent, PutPage, SetBlobMetadata, SetBlobProperties, SetBlobServiceProperties, SetContainerACL, SetContainerMetadata, SnapshotBlob and UndeleteBlob.

2 The following API calls are considered to be read operations: AcquireBlobLease, AcquireContainerLease, BlobPreflightRequest, GeoBootstrap, GetBlob, GetBlobLeaseInfo, GetBlobMetadata, GetBlobProperties, GetBlobServiceProperties, GetBlobServiceStats, GetBlockList, GetContainerACL, GetContainerMetadata, GetContainerProperties, GetCopyInformation, GetEncryptionKey, GetPageRegions, ReleaseBlobLease, ReleaseContainerLease, RenewBlobLease and RenewContainerLease.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading requests from an Read-access Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) account at least 99.99% of the time (99.9% for the Cool Access Tier), provided that we will retry in the secondary zone from the data writing failure from the primary zone.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading from Locally redundant storage (LRS) and Geo Redundant Storage (GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cool Access Tier).

We guarantee that we can successfully process data writing requests into Locally redundant storage (LRS) and geo-redundant storage (GRS) accounts and read and access Read-access Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cool Access Tier).

To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

The Managed Disk itself doesn’t provide a Service Level Agreement with financial support. The availability of a Managed Disk depends on the Service Level Agreement governing the basic storage used and the Virtual Machine it’s attached to. To learn more about the details of the Service Level Agreements for the Managed Disk, please visit the Managed Disk Service Level Agreements page.

TextpageLeftNav.metaDescription: View pricing details for Azure Page Blob Storage (enterprise cloud storage service for data storage). No upfront costs. Pay as you go. Free trial.
